titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to protect the rights of crime victims.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution and Civil Justice.

bill.summary:
4/23/2013--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits denial or abridgement of the rights of a crime victim to fairness, respect, and dignity. Grants a crime victim the right: (1) to reasonable notice of, and to not be excluded from, public proceedings relating to the offense; (2) to be heard at any release, plea, sentencing, or other such proceeding involving any right established under this amendment; (3) to proceedings free from unreasonable delay; (4) to reasonable notice of the release or escape of the accused; (5) to due consideration of the crime victim's safety and privacy; and (6) to restitution.
Grants the crime victim, or the victim's lawful representative, standing to fully assert and enforce such rights in any court.
